thread.title: New Bose SoundTouch 10 multiroom speaker unveiled with advanced Spotify integration - Tech
thread.title_full: New Bose SoundTouch 10 multiroom speaker unveiled with advanced Spotify integration - Tech News - Digital Spy

author: Luke Johnson
title: New Bose SoundTouch 10 multiroom speaker unveiled with advanced Spotify integration - Tech
text: Bose has updated its home speaker collection, with the Bose SoundTouch 10 combining Bluetooth and Wireless audio capabilities to bring music convenience to every room of your home.Marking a new entry point into the audio specialist's answer to the likes of Sonos, the SoundTouch 10 speaker sits beneath a pair of big brothers, the SoundTouch 20 and, yep, you guessed it, SoundTouch 30. © Digital Spy Best Bluetooth speakersDespite its compact size - the SoundTouch 10 measures just 21.1cm tall and 14.1cm wide - the speaker is capable of pumping out some serious beats thanks to a new, 2.5-inch Unidome transducer.With Bluetooth offering instant pairing and Wi-Fi ensuring strong, reliable, lengthy connections, the new speaker plays nice with the audio specialist's SoundTouch app, which now features integrated Spotify support for the first time.The benefit? Well, as well as the world of internet radio, Spotify's world of music and curated playlists are available without losing intimate control of your speaker or multi-speaker settings. © Digital Spy With six channel pre-set buttons featuring on the app, speaker itself and accompanying remote, it's also effortlessly easy to jump direct to your favourite listening material, be it radio station, album or artist.Available in both black and white colour schemes, with a £165.95 price tag, the Bose SoundTouch 10 is the company's most affordable multiroom speaker yet.
